dear David,
I have a CSTR reactor! 
do you think it is possible to simulate the behavior
of cool-flames?




--- David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> ha scritto:

> The warnings resulting from the -arch i386 flag are
> not a problem. By  
> default, python tries to build a universal binary.
> This warning just  
> means that your compiled code will run on ppc
> architectures, but not  
> i386 ones.
> 
> The file setup.m is generated and then later removed
> in the build  
> process. Actually all it does is change to the
> 'cantera' directory  
> and then invoke 'buildux.m' to build the Cantera
> toolbox. If Matlab  
> can't find the setup.m file, check that the current
> directory is on  
> the Matlab search path.
> 
> One thing to be aware of on the mac: Matlab R2006b
> for the PowerPC  
> architecture is compiled with g++ 3.3, and so all of
> Cantera must be  
> compiled with this version of g++ too to use it in
> Matlab.  On the  
> other hand, Python is compiled with g++ 4.x, and
> Cantera must be  
> built with this compiler version to use it in
> Python. What this means  
> is that if you want to use Cantera in both Python
> and Matlab, you  
> need to build two separate versions.
> 
> On the Intel i386 platform, Matlab R2006b is
> compiled with g++ 4.x,  
> and this problem doesn't arise.
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> 
> On May 21, 2007, at 8:30 AM, agentesilvia wrote:
> 
> > I still haven't been able to install Cantera but I
> admit that in  
> > this days I've been quite
> > busy�
> > As I've said before there is no `setup.m' script
> in the Cantera/ 
> > matlab folder but looking
> > better I've seen an error in the python building
> procedure that  
> > occurs just before the
> > Matlab building procedure: it seems that a wrong 
> `�arch i386' is  
> > issued to the g++
> > compiler just before the correct `-arch ppc' and
> this generates a  
> > lot of errors�
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > running build_ext
> > building 'Cantera._cantera' extension
> > creating build/temp.macosx-10.3-fat-2.5
> > creating build/temp.macosx-10.3-fat-2.5/src
> > g++ -arch ppc -arch i386 -isysroot
> /Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.4u.sdk - 
> > fno-strict-
> > aliasing -Wno-long-double -no-cpp-precomp
> -mno-fused-madd -fno-
